definition: to invert right and wrong
top (of the head)/apex/to fall forwards/inverted/to jolt
to place upside down/to invert/to pour/to throw out/to move backwards/however/actually/as a matter of fact/contrary to expectation
to fall/to collapse/to lie horizontally/to overthrow/to fail/to go bankrupt/to change (trains or buses)/to move around/to resell at a profit
is/are/am/yes/to be
variant of 是[shi4]/(used in given names)
abbr. for 非洲[Fei1 zhou1], Africa
to not be/not/wrong/incorrect/non-/un-/in-/to reproach or blame/(colloquial) to insist on/simply must

sentences.english: We use it to describe someone who confuses right and wrong deliberately.
sentences.chinese: 我们用它来形容那些故意颠倒是非的人。

sentences.english: No matter how unfair or wrong.
sentences.chinese: 不管有多么不公平或是颠倒是非。

sentences.english: This act of confusing right and wrong can not be accepted by the Chinese side.
sentences.chinese: 这种颠倒是非的做法是中方所不能接受的。

sentences.english: Yea, surely God will not do wickedly, neither will the Almighty pervert judgment.
sentences.chinese: 真的，神必不作恶，全能者也必不颠倒是非。

sentences.english: All these indicate the wild ambition of Japanese Fascist militarism arid the confusion of right and wrong.
sentences.chinese: 这些足见日本法西斯军国主义的狼子野心和颠倒是非。

definition: lit. to invert black and white (idiom); to distort the truth deliberately/to misrepresent the facts/to invert right and wrong
to confuse right and wrong (idiom)
unable to distinguish right and wrong (idiom)
to confuse black and white/to say that black is white/fig. not to distinguish right from wrong
can't tell black from white (idiom); unable to distinguish wrong from right
to speak off the cuff/to casually opine
variant of 誣衊|诬蔑[wu1 mie4]
to slander/to smear/to vilify
making a deer out to be a horse (idiom); deliberate misrepresentation
to twist words and force logic (idiom)/sophistry/loud rhetoric making up for fallacious argument/shoving false arguments down people's throats
to start rumours and create trouble
to lie through one's teeth (idiom)/to talk drivel
pinyin: zheng1 zhe5 yan3 jing1 shuo1 xia1 hua4

definition: to lie through one's teeth (idiom)/to talk drivel
to sow dissension (idiom); to drive a wedge between
to slander/to smear/to tarnish
variant of 污衊|污蔑[wu1 mie4]
to incite a quarrel (idiom); to sow discord between people/to tell tales/to make mischief
to pester endlessly (idiom)/an annoying troublemaker
